Articles.Content:
Alright, I already know the answer to this one. Read it in a book somewhere in the past. However, I am going to avoid answering it simply because I don't have a riddle of my own (Though I am not above providing the answer to said riddle to someone else)

-Hic-

Also, good job Xan for solving Ethanadam's riddle. I knew I had heard it before, but for the life of me couldn't remember the answer.

I GOT IT!! He had hiccups.

Just a sec while I think of a riddle.

I GOT IT!! He had hiccups.

DING DING DI-

Stop with all the noise!

*Ahem* Yes, well done! Can't wait to hear the aftermath of said guess.

A man falls out of a thirty-story building. After he hits the ground, he gets up, brushes himself off, and walks off to get back into the building. How is this possible? The man is not invincible, the ground is not soft or unusual in any way.
He didn't fall from the thirtieth story.

He didn't fall from the thirtieth story.

Yes, more specifically, he fell from the ground floor. Good luck on your riddle.
This post is now obsolete. Just look past it, and if it can be deleted, great. This was the result of a ninja.
You can delete posts by the way
I can't think of anything, so someone else can take a turn.

One I thought up on the bus. And yeah, I'm just copy-pasting and tweaking a bit.

A man falls thirty storeys out of a thirty-storey building. After he hits the ground, he gets up, brushes himself off, and walks off to get back into the building. How is this possible? The man is not invincible, the ground is not soft or unusual in any way.
Did he use a parachute or hang glider?

Did he fall from the ground floor thirty times?

Is the building a small model?

Did he fall from the ground floor thirty times?
You're too good.

Ok, my riddle is a rather easy one.

Two fathers and two sons walk into a candy store. They each buy something for $0.50 but they only spent $1.50. How is that possible?

One is both father and son. Grandfather, father, son.

Could be done in only two people, because all fathers are also sons.
Yup, you got it right. ^^

BlueSubstance's riddle was out of turn, so unless TheMoonRover waves play on it should still be their turn to make the next riddle.

Hailstones?

Or snowflakes? Something like that anyway.

BlueSubstance's riddle was out of turn, so unless TheMoonRover waves play on it should still be their turn to make the next riddle.

Might as well carry on.

Sorry, TheMoonRover, missed that the other riddle was out of turn.

But snowflakes is correct, so it's your turn anyway.

Now I have to think of a riddle...

You see me quite often,

But you don't really care.

And when you pass by me,

You often stop and stare.

I cannot speak or see,

But don't think me uncouth,

Because I'm so perfect,

I always tell the truth.

What am I?
A camera?
A mirror?

A mirror?

Yep, that's the one.
